issues.description: The template repository’s Farm.java defines a class named AnimalFarm instead of the class Farm specified in the UML diagram and shown in the reference solution. This class‐name mismatch (and the extraneous nested package/class declarations) prevents students from creating or referencing the intended Farm class and causes compilation errors.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the class in Farm.java from AnimalFarm to Farm (matching both the problem statement and solution), remove any unintended nested declarations, and ensure the file name and class name align.

issues.description: In the template’s Farm.java, the helper method singFarmSongVerse is declared without its Animal parameter (commented out), conflicting with the UML specification and the reference solution, which both require a signature singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal). Without the parameter, students cannot implement verses correctly.
issues.suggested_fix: Restore the parameter in the method signature to private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal) in the template, matching the UML diagram and reference solution.

issues.description: The template repository defines the class as 'AnimalFarm' (in Farm.java) whereas the problem statement and reference solution consistently refer to this entity as 'Farm'. This mismatch prevents students from mapping the 'Farm' concept described in the exercise to the provided starter code.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the class 'AnimalFarm' to 'Farm' in template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Farm.java to match the problem statement and solution implementation.
